intro: Dictyostega orobanchoides subsp. purdieana, commonly known as the slender sticklily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, commonly referred to as the broomrape family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. The species is noted for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to harsh, dry conditions.
